attributes.action: Attend this site and, every month or so, provide detailed account about petitions that come under your consideration.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I think that we, people who use this site, and British citizens in general, have the right to know how our ideas are being treated by the government. 
I resubmit this petition although it was rejected on the grounds that  petitions.pm.gov.uk/faking/ is similar.
Please notice there are differences:
The faking petition requires the PM to ACT according to petitions results.
This one asks the PM to communicate openly with petitioners. This site promises that petitioner will be individually contacted by No. 10 after the petitions deadline, and that they will get a response to their petition's plight. Attempting to avoid  divide and rule policy, this petition asks the PM to be open about which petitions are being considered - and provide details about that. This, I hope, will open up the process on this site for full debates and public scrutiny. 
Also, check petitions.pm.gov.uk/search?q=faith+schools for similarities allowed..
